html:
7.25.17  12:02 pm   When people talk about the "downbeat" do they mean the 1 and 3 of each bar (in 4/4 time) with the 2 and 4 being the upbeat? Or is the downbeat the 1st eighth note and the second eightnote (or "the and" of the beat) the upbeat?

     the downbeat usually means any of the 4 quarter notes (in 4/4 for example). the upbeat is the in between 8th note. the 2 and 4 can be called the 'backbeat' if there is a snare, clap, etc happening there. 1 and 3 would be the 'white beat' because that's when all the white people clap. god bless, they're trying their hardest

7.25.17  10:36 am   I read one question where you said you wanted to make more lengthy content, then I read another where you said you wanted to focus more on 30 sec - 4 min videos. Im Confused.

     i don't know which question you read, but ever since doing history of the world, i have been very clear about keeping things between 30 seconds and 4 minutes, roughly. i mentioned that time frame many many times (although it is approximate), including saying focusing on things of a 'medium size.' this is mostly still a lot longer than the majority of my videos from 2014 and 2015. i'm not sure if that answers your question

7.25.17  7:41 am   Have you noticed that there's not a lot of good words to rhyme with "love"? I can't keep writing about gloves and doves.. above is good,
but it's weird using that if the rhyming scheme comes at the end of the phrase. 

     i think exact rhyming is kind of a myth, especially in music. not necessary, and sometimes not even the best choice. for 'love', 'of' is probably my best 'exact' choice, 'enough' is equally strong, then if we think outside the box a little, try 'one', 'none', 'done', ... i think if you try words with that sound as a rhyme for 'love', i think it will sound just fine. especially if you are making sure that the lines are something you want to say, not just something to try to force a rhyme. in music, as long as the vowel sound is the same, that's really all that matters. i actually think it often sounds better when the consonant sound at the end is a little different. it's kind of like when the daily speical is a little different than it was yesterday

7.25.17  7:29 am   Opinions on questions?

     they are the first step in finding answers

7.25.17  5:46 am   Are mathematicians scientists?

     sure

7.25.17  5:39 am   What is bread?

     it's like a pillow you can eat

     because that's not the password. there is no password

     because it is the latest note that is currently posted on the notebook page

7.25.17  2:34 am   hey, sorry but i don't think i've made myself very clear. I know what sus chords are, but i don't understand the math of it in a chord progression. like, it can be either tonic or dominant, but where does it apply in composing songs (besides if it sounds good etc)

     if you are using chords for reasons other than how they sound, then you are doing this very differently from me

How do you do that?

7.24.17  11:23 pm   If you do improv on youtube how would you present it? Like would you clean up your improv into a segment and add graphics to make it into something like the steve video of the short songs video?

     it would be possible to actually take improv clips, edit them tight (like the ones i've edited for the site) and dub them / reconstruct them with real timing, and also make videos to go with them. i have done all of these elements individually, of things like this, but never really done a full blown version. it is on my to-do list to try it

     i think you answered your question!

7.24.17  10:00 pm   say you have a dome. at what point does the rim stop being a wall and start being a ceiling

     it's all dome baby

7.24.17  8:46 pm   do more things please

     i've been doing as many as i can, as fast as i can, for a long time

7.24.17  8:45 pm   have you ever been working on a song/video and a fan on this page says something like  "hey you should make a song/video about this thing!" ...and their suggestion was actually exactly (or very nearly exactly) what you were currently working on? 

     the only time i think it has ever happened was during the making of history of the entire world, maybe one or two people suggested it. which is a surprisingly low amount, considering the daily requests to do videos about single countries. i was surprised that almost no one thought of the (i thought obvious) challenge of doing the entire world

     i am not subscribed to anyone. but i think vsauce is subscribed to me

7.24.17  7:18 pm   Do you know any instruments besides guitar?

7.24.17  6:59 pm   Do you think that somebody's who has never picked up an instrument and knows nothing about music theory can appreciate music or have the same love of music as a musician?

     yes

     I feel like the answer should be yes... But, at the same time, I'm not so sure... There's definitely something about creating/playing music that may give you a special connection. I'm not a "professional" musician by any stretch of the imagination (i just play with friends, occasionally do some recordings for fun).. but all my friends play music. so much of my free time is spent playing/writing music and it's just such a huge part of my life.

7.24.17  6:45 pm   trick question: what is that?

     the thing you're pointing at. in fact, 'that' is short for "THing i'm pointing AT"

7.24.17  6:38 pm   Hi, I want to learn to improvise on the piano. I have about 10 years of piano lessons behind me, but I still can't seem to "just make stuff up" I don't understand how some people can just listen to a tune and improvise something that sounds incredible off of it. I know some music theory so I can do very simple harmony beneath a melody that I've heard, but I don't know how to make it sound good or jazzy. When I try to mess around on the piano I always revert back to trying to follow the rules I've been taught but failing to turn it into an effective song. Do you have any ideas or tips for how I might be able to improvise more effectively and learn how to harmonize in ways that sound good and rich to me and others?

     sounds like you are going to want to develop a more intimate relationship with the piano, on a more personable level

7.24.17  5:37 pm   Bill! Crossfades in audio editing can go a looooooong way (and very likely just one shortcut away in whatever program you use to edit!), unless you really mean to leave those clicks and pops from audio cuts in the reality videos as part of the package/statement/journal. 

      if you are interested in hearing some of my work with grade-A top notch professional cross-fades, please check out the music or videos on the songs page, the videos page, my youtube channel, or iTunes or Spotify. i am trying to spend as much time as possible on content for those channels -- and one of the ways i accomplish this is by skipping the crossfades on the reality videos

7.24.17  5:14 pm   Can anyone understand S P A C E and T I M E

     i think the problem most of us have is we understand it far to well to even understand it at all. i know that might not make sense but i think it's true

     it depends how many you want

     no, you will discover a lot of magic when you study architecture

7.24.17  3:59 pm   how are babies made

     they are usually built by 2 other babies

7.24.17  3:58 pm   Hey bill, thank you for answering my question. Your response made me seriously think about my current situation. At this point I am 20 and there is so much I want to prove, I want to grow beyond measures and make an impact in the animation industry (my life goal). I know I must resolve myself to this goal. Do you feel like you have to choose? Between a relationship with someone or working in solitude. I haven't received an assault of questions of when I am going to get married or settle down yet but I know in the few years I will. It's a suffocating feeling. I hope this isn't intrusive but did you go through something similar and what are you thoughts?

     it's a classic situation for focused and hardworking artists (or any career) to find themselves in a relationship where the other person realizes that the artist needs to make their work the #1 priority. it is a very common story, but not the end of the world. it just means those types of relationships won't work. this is very very common, and it is also common for hardworking and focused artists to find relationships that work. usually when the other person has equally strong passions of their own, maybe different, maybe even the same one. i've seen this work plenty of times. but the failed relationship you're talking about is a classic story, and very common among people in your situation. i've been in one of those relationships as well. it's no big deal, you just learn why it doesn't work, and you both move on

     no

7.24.17  3:50 pm   How about greedy companies and politicians attempting to repeal net neutrality? That's pretty wacky right?

     looks like someone is going to have to find a new way to invent freedom

7.24.17  3:35 pm   Does your ability to work hard depend on your environment?  If so, is it the correct decision to leave the environments that don't foster hard work?

7.24.17  3:27 pm   You said you update reality once a day, but the latest one showing up for me is 2.16.16, which you added to the page 2 days ago. Why is that?

     because yesterday i woke up with a crazy fever and a ridiculous headache. in bed all day and all night. to compensate, i've done 2 today, because i knew you were going to say that

7.24.17  3:07 pm   can all theories be thought of as conspiracy theories?

     sure!

7.24.17  2:45 pm   Frank Zappa once said that "II-V-I's" are the essence of all bad white jazz. Your thoughts on that?

     there are many different sounding things that might classify as a II-V-I, many of which can be found in great black hip-hop, as well as a multitude of other places

7.24.17  2:44 pm   i don't understand the harmonic function of Sus chords. Seems to me like a chord that's dominant but cute, and like a shortcut to chords that leads to another colours. what do you think about it?

     a good starting point to understanding sus chords is: play a C major triad (C, E, G). ok now play it with F note instead of E: (C, F, G). that is called Csus4. ok now play Csus4, then C. nice! Ok now also there is a rumor going around that if you use 2 instead of 4 (C,D,G) that is called Csus2, but that one doesn't really take as much pleaseure in the resolve as the Csus4 to C resolve. but it's still easier to say Csus2 than to say Cadd2no3. even quicker to just say C2, which is what i usually say. also you may have noticed that Csus4 can be the same as Fsus2, depending on whether the bass player is playing C or F. i'm not sure if that answers your question.

7.24.17  2:42 pm   Are you still thinking bout doin an album?

     i'm still not sure if it's better to release songs singularly or in groups. i always flip flop on this issue

7.24.17  1:38 pm   yo I read your answer to some question about wishes and you would really not wish for anything? if you had the power wouldn't you wanna end poverty or eradicate cancer or stop crime or something??

7.24.17  1:15 pm   How long before the music of today gets played on classic rock radio stations?
